word: lay one’s cards on the table

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be open and honest about one's intentions and feelings.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 對自己的意圖和感受保持開放和誠實

examples.sentence: It's time to [lay my cards on the table] and explain my plan.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 是時候我誠實地解釋我的計畫了。

examples.sentence: He decided to [lay his cards on the table] to avoid misunderstandings.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他決定坦率地表達，以避免誤解。

examples.sentence: In a relationship, it's important to [lay your cards on the table].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在一段關係中，誠實非常重要。

word: like water off a duck’s back

meanings.meaning_en_US: Not easily affected by criticism or negativity.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不容易受到批評或負面情緒的影響

examples.sentence: He just brushes off insults; they roll off him [like water off a duck's back].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他對侮辱不以為意，這些批評對他來說都是浮雲。

examples.sentence: For her, criticism is [like water off a duck's back].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 對她來說，批評沒有任何影響。
others: kill two birds with one stone
cross that bridge when we come to it

examples.sentence: He handles criticism [like water off a duck's back].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他對批評的反應就像水滾鴨背。

word: not playing with a full deck

meanings.meaning_en_US: Someone who is mentally unstable or not very intelligent.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 顯示精神不穩定或不太聰明

examples.sentence: After hearing his ideas, I realized he is [not playing with a full deck].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 聽了他的想法後，我意識到他的精神不太正常。

examples.sentence: She's always making strange comments; I think she’s [not playing with a full deck].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她總是發表奇怪的評論，我認為她心智不太正常。
others: hit the nail on the head

examples.sentence: If you talk to him, you'll see he's [not playing with a full deck].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你與他交談，你會發現他的心智不太清晰。
others: give him a taste of his own medicine

word: penny-wise and pound-foolish

meanings.meaning_en_US: Careful with small amounts of money but wasteful with larger amounts.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 對小金額節儉，但對大金額浪費

examples.sentence: Cutting costs on small things can be [penny-wise and pound-foolish].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在小事情上削減成本可能會得不償失。

examples.sentence: He is [penny-wise and pound-foolish] by not investing in quality.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他對品質的不投入其實是得不償失。

examples.sentence: Being [penny-wise and pound-foolish] is a common mistake.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 變得斤斤計較是常見的錯誤。

word: take it with a grain of salt

meanings.meaning_en_US: To view something skeptically or to not take it seriously.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 以懷疑的態度看待某事，或不把它當真

examples.sentence: When she tells stories, I always [take them with a grain of salt].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 每當她講故事時，我總是持懷疑態度。

examples.sentence: You should [take it with a grain of salt] when reading online reviews.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 閱讀在線評價時，應持懷疑態度。
others: work your fingers to the bone

examples.sentence: I tend to [take things with a grain of salt] when it comes to gossip.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 談到八卦時，我往往不會太當真。

word: take it with a pinch of salt

meanings.meaning_en_US: Similar to 'take it with a grain of salt'; suggests skepticism.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 和“take it with a grain of salt”類似，意味著懷疑

examples.sentence: You'd better [take that claim with a pinch of salt].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你最好對那個聲稱持懷疑態度。

examples.sentence: When he talks about his achievements, I always [take it with a pinch of salt].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他談到他的成就時，我總是持懷疑態度。

examples.sentence: It’s wise to [take everything he says with a pinch of salt].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 對他所說的每一句話抱懷疑態度是明智的。

word: variety is the spice of life

meanings.meaning_en_US: Different experiences or activities make life more enjoyable.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不同的經歷或活動使生活更愉快

examples.sentence: Traveling is great because [variety is the spice of life].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 旅行很好，因為多樣性才能使生活更有趣。
others: take it with a grain of salt

examples.sentence: For her, exploring new hobbies proves that [variety is the spice of life].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 對她來說，探索新的愛好證明了多樣性讓生活更有趣。

examples.sentence: He often says, [variety is the spice of life], especially at work.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他常常說，變化使工作更有趣。

word: wake up and smell the coffee

meanings.meaning_en_US: To become aware of the realities or truths of a situation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 意識到現實或某個事情的真相

examples.sentence: She needs to [wake up and smell the coffee] about her job situation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她需要對自己的工作狀況意識到現實。
others: hit the nail on the head

examples.sentence: He was dreaming too big; it’s time for him to [wake up and smell the coffee].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他想得太美了；是時候現實一點了。

examples.sentence: Sometimes you have to [wake up and smell the coffee] to move forward.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有時候你必須要意識到現實才能向前進。

word: walk in someone else’s shoes

meanings.meaning_en_US: To understand someone else's perspective or experiences.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 理解他人的觀點或經歷

examples.sentence: Before judging her, try to [walk in her shoes].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在評判她之前，先試著理解她的處境。

examples.sentence: He often reminds us to [walk in someone else's shoes] before making decisions.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他經常提醒我們在做決策之前先理解他人的處境。

examples.sentence: To connect with others, you need to [walk in their shoes].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 要與他人建立聯繫，你需要理解他們的處境。

word: all that glitters is not gold

meanings.meaning_en_US: Not everything that appears valuable is truly valuable.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 並不是所有看起來珍貴的東西都是珍貴的

examples.sentence: Just because he is rich doesn’t mean he is happy; [all that glitters is not gold].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 僅僅因為他有錢並不意味著他快樂；並不是所有表面上看起來好的都是好的。

examples.sentence: Her beauty is captivating, but remember, [all that glitters is not gold].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的美麗令人著迷，但要記住，並非所有表面看起來好的都是好的。

examples.sentence: In life, [all that glitters is not gold]; you need to look deeper.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在生活中，並不是所有表面上看起來好的都是好的；你需要看得更深。

word: carry the weight of the world

meanings.meaning_en_US: To feel an overwhelming burden or responsibility.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 感覺到壓倒性的負擔或責任

examples.sentence: He felt like he was [carrying the weight of the world] after his father's passing.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在父親去世後，他感覺自己承擔著全世界的重擔。

examples.sentence: Sometimes, it seems like we are [carrying the weight of the world] with our responsibilities.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有時候，我們似乎負擔著世界的重任，面對各種責任。
others: take it with a grain of salt

examples.sentence: She carries her family's expectations; it's like [carrying the weight of the world].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她承擔著家庭的期望，感覺就像承擔著全世界的重擔。

word: fly by the seat of your pants

meanings.meaning_en_US: To do something without planning or without any particular skill.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在沒有計劃或沒有特定技巧的情況下去做事

examples.sentence: I had to [fly by the seat of my pants] during that presentation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在那次演示中，我不得不隨機應變。

examples.sentence: He often [flies by the seat of his pants] when it comes to decision-making.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在決策時，他經常隨心所欲。

examples.sentence: Sometimes I just [fly by the seat of my pants] when cooking new recipes.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有時候我做新食譜時就隨心所欲。

word: give the benefit of the doubt

meanings.meaning_en_US: To decide to believe someone or to assume the best in someone.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 決定相信某人或假設某人有善意

examples.sentence: I will [give him the benefit of the doubt] despite the rumors.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 儘管有謠言，我仍然決定給他一個機會。
others: take it with a grain of salt
keep your cards close to your chest

examples.sentence: It's important to [give others the benefit of the doubt].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 給予他人機會是很重要的。

examples.sentence: Even if you doubt her claims, try to [give her the benefit of the doubt].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 即使你對她的說法心存懷疑，也應該試著給她一個機會。

word: have one’s head in the clouds

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be daydreaming or not paying attention to reality.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 做白日夢或不關注現實

examples.sentence: He’s always [having his head in the clouds] instead of focusing on work.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他總是在做白日夢，而不是關注工作。

examples.sentence: If you [have your head in the clouds], you might miss important details.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你心不在焉，你可能會錯過重要細節。

examples.sentence: Daydreaming means [having your head in the clouds].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 做白日夢就是心不在焉。
others: have your feet on the ground

word: have your cake and eat it too

meanings.meaning_en_US: To have two incompatible things at the same time.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 同時擁有兩件不相容的事物

examples.sentence: You can’t [have your cake and eat it too]; you will have to choose.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你不能同時擁有；必須做出選擇。

examples.sentence: In life, you often can’t [have your cake and eat it too].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在生活中，你常常不能兼得。

examples.sentence: He wants to travel and save money, but he can’t [have his cake and eat it too].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他想旅行又想存錢，但不能兼得。

word: hear it through the grapevine

meanings.meaning_en_US: To hear rumors or unofficial information.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 聽到謠言或非官方資訊

examples.sentence: I heard [through the grapevine] that they are planning a surprise party.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我聽說他們正計劃舉辦一個驚喜派對。

examples.sentence: She knows more than she lets on; I think she’s [been hearing it through the grapevine].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她知道的比她表現出來的多；我覺得她是通過謠言知道的。

examples.sentence: He admitted that he [heard it through the grapevine] about the job opening.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他承認他是從謠言中聽到這份工作的機會。

word: kill two birds with one stone

meanings.meaning_en_US: To achieve two goals with a single action.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 用一個行動實現兩個目標

examples.sentence: By carpooling, I can [kill two birds with one stone].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 通過拼車，我可以同時達到兩個目標。

examples.sentence: Studying while exercising allows you to [kill two birds with one stone].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在運動的同時學習可以達到兩個目的。

examples.sentence: I plan to [kill two birds with one stone] by visiting my friends and exploring the city.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我計劃通過拜訪朋友和探索城市來達到兩個目標。

word: laugh all the way to the bank

meanings.meaning_en_US: To profit financially, especially when unexpectedly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 意外獲利，尤其是當你沒有預期時

examples.sentence: After that investment, he is [laughing all the way to the bank].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在那次投資後，他意外獲利。

examples.sentence: When the product sold out, we were [laughing all the way to the bank].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當產品售罄時，我們獲得了意外的財利。

examples.sentence: She’s [laughing all the way to the bank] after her successful business venture.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在她的成功商業冒險之後，她獲得了意外的利益。

word: laughter is the best medicine

meanings.meaning_en_US: Laughter has a positive effect on health and well-being.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 笑對健康和福祉有積極影響

examples.sentence: After a stressful day, a good laugh is [the best medicine].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在壓力大的日子裡，開心的大笑是最好的解藥。
others: hit the nail on the head

examples.sentence: They always say, [laughter is the best medicine] for a reason.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們這樣說是有原因的，笑是最好的解藥。
others: burn the candle at both ends

examples.sentence: Whenever she feels down, she remembers that [laughter is the best medicine].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 每當她感到沮喪時，她會記住，笑是最好的解藥。

word: make hay while the sun shines

meanings.meaning_en_US: To take advantage of favorable conditions.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 利用有利的條件

examples.sentence: Now that the weather's nice, let's [make hay while the sun shines].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 既然天氣好，我們就應該把握時機。

examples.sentence: With this opportunity, we should [make hay while the sun shines].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在這個機會下，我們應該好好把握。

examples.sentence: Remember to [make hay while the sun shines] and seize the moment.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 記得要把握時機，抓住當下的機會。
